meanings.definition: Peroxisomes: Organelles found in eukaryotic cells that contain enzymes involved in various metabolic processes.
meanings.sent1: The peroxisomes in the cell help with important chemical reactions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study peroxisomes to understand how cells function.
meanings.sent3: The peroxisomes in the cell are like tiny factories producing essential molecules.
meanings.sent4: In the world of cells, peroxisomes are the busy workers keeping everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, peroxisomes look like bustling hubs of activity.

meanings.definition: Peroxisomes: Small, membrane-bound structures within cells that play a role in lipid metabolism and detoxification.
meanings.sent1: Lipid metabolism relies on the peroxisomes to break down fats.
meanings.sent2: The body uses peroxisomes to get rid of harmful substances.
meanings.sent3: The peroxisomes are like the clean-up crew of the cell, getting rid of waste.
meanings.sent4: In the cell's neighborhood, peroxisomes are the recycling centers keeping things tidy.
meanings.sent5: Peroxisomes work tirelessly to detoxify the cell from harmful compounds.
